creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text: Using Internet Explorer 5.5, the page generates a partial header and html. I can't find the problem on Netscape 4.72. The problem also does not occur when using Tomcat directly. However, it does occur when using the both the ApacheModuleJServ.dll and mod_jk.dll with Apache.

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
I can't duplicate this using 3.2.2b1, mod_jk.dll and Apache 1.3.9 on Win2000.  
If you could provide any additional information about how you duplicate the 
problem we can investigate it further.

creator: kxd0551@bellatlantic.net
text:
Specifically, I am attempting to use response.sendRedirect ("anysubdirectory\filename.jsp"); The problem only occurs on IE when redirecting to JSP pages. It does not occur on Static page redirects. In my tests, I created a JSP page that when submitted posts to itself and then attempts to redirect to a JSP page located in a subdirectory. I'd like to reiterate that the problem does not occur when redirecting to static pages. Here is my sample page: "login.jsp" <% response.setHeader("Pragma", "no-cache"); %> Apache Mod_JK SendRedirect Test <% // Stripped out validation code and simply redirecting to another page if(request.getParameterValues("SignIn")!=null) { // Change this to any other JSP file not in current directory response.sendRedirect("/pulse/brands/arthro/index.jsp"); } %>
Member ID:  
Password:

I have also tested the mod_jk.dll using IIS version  and the problem occurs 
there also.  I think that the problem is probably in the mod_jk and jserv 
modules.
creator: kxd0551@bellatlantic.net
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: redirect() should be at the beginning of the page, before sending content.
